title: Adam Nicol
text:
Adam Nicol (born 2 July 1997 in <a href="Aberdeen">Aberdeen</a>, <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a>) is a <a href="Scotland%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland U20</a> international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who plays for <a href="Jersey%20Reds">Jersey Reds</a> at the <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%233.%20Prop">Tighthead Prop</a> position. He previously played for <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> and <a href="Stirling%20County%20RFC">Stirling County</a>.
Rugby Union career.
Amateur career.
Nicol grew up in Bermuda and started at the Bermuda Youth Rugby Program, representing Bermuda as a school boy V Cayman in 2008. On return to Scotland he started out with <a href="Dunfermline%20RFC">Dunfermline</a>, Nicol moved on to play for <a href="Glasgow%20University%20RFC">Glasgow University</a>, <a href="Glasgow%20Hawks%20RFC">Glasgow Hawks</a> and then <a href="Stirling%20County%20RFC">Stirling County</a>. He studies Earth Sciences at <a href="Glasgow%20University">Glasgow University</a>.
Nicol has been drafted to <a href="Stirling%20County%20RFC">Stirling County</a> in the <a href="Scottish%20Premiership%20%28rugby%29">Scottish Premiership</a> for the 2018-19 season.
Professional career.
On 25 November <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20Glasgow%20Warriors%20season">2016</a>, Nicol played for <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> against <a href="Ospreys%20%28rugby%20union%29">Ospreys</a> in the <a href="Pro14">Pro12</a>, replacing <a href="D%27Arcy%20Rae">D'Arcy Rae</a> at <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%233.%20Prop">Tighthead Prop</a>. He became <a href="List%20of%20Glasgow%20Warriors%20players">Glasgow Warrior No. 275</a>.
He was enrolled in the <a href="Scottish%20Rugby%20Academy">Scottish Rugby Academy</a> for their <a href="Scottish%20Rugby%20Academy%202017%E2%80%9318">2017-18</a> intake as a Stage 3 player. Stage 3 players are assigned a professional club; Nicol was assigned to <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a>. 
He played again for <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> in their opening match of the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Glasgow%20Warriors%20season">2017-18 season</a> - against <a href="Northampton%20Saints">Northampton Saints</a> at <a href="Bridgehaugh%20Park">Bridgehaugh Park</a>, <a href="Stirling">Stirling</a> on 19 August 2017. He made 18 competitive appearances for the club.
On 9 April 2021 it was announced that he had joined <a href="Jersey%20Reds">Jersey Reds</a> with immediate effect. The deal is initially a loan to the end of the season, but the move will be made permanent thereafter.
International career.
Nicol was picked for <a href="Scotland%20national%20under-16%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> at U16 level.
He then moved up in his international career with Scotland at Under 18 level, playing against England in Match 2015.
He received his first Scotland U20 cap against England in the Under 20 Six Nations of 2016.
Whilst with the U20 side Nicol displayed a level of destructive scrummaging rare in age grade rugby and confirmed his status as one of the biggest prospects in Scottish rugby.
